author: Eduardo Ortega
summary: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website.
title: Plantillas con (Hu)go

author: Eduardo Ortega
summary: Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output. Hugo keeps all static content under static. You should therefore move it all there. With Jekyll, something that looked like
title: Migrar a Hugo desde Jekyll
